But when they caught sight of Apelles’ work,
They began to snort and bridle.
Such a judgment, from innocent Animals,
Has afterwards been handed down more.

26. This competition of our Forebears
makes us notice how seriously they studied Art,
and attesting to this are works still left over,
for example in Venice, over the Church portal,
four copper Horses, outstandingly beautiful.
And in Rome, displayed on the Capitoline,
a cast Horse surpassing Nature,
and life itself, but no Art is excluded.
left-middleExamples of very fine Ancient Horses, in Venice and Rome.

27. Near there are the Horses of Monte Cavallo
by Praxiteles and Phidias’ hands.
From all these do not stray
In knowledge about beauty, one shall derive
A good design and proper understanding.
Because I know of no place or Country
in the World which will better teach us
the finest and best from real life.

28. There is no doubt that the ancients
made use of ecorchés, and also those of Animals,
which they examined in full.
Now I wish to acquaint you, O happy spirits,
with all the qualities of other Animals,
and will now engage in describing
the largest of the cattle,
such as Bulls, Oxen and Cows.
left-middleThe ancients made use of ecorché Horses.

29. Although Heifers, Cows, Oxen and Bulls
greatly resemble one another, and while
they surely possess similar features,
the eyes of Bulls are not so kindly;
their faces are far more terrifying,
and their ears have thicker hair
than those of Oxen, and in the main
their horns are thinner and smaller.
left-middleBulls’ horns are much smaller than those of Oxen.
